org.foxlabs.validation.constraint

Interface Constraint<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of value to be validated
    All Superinterfaces:
    Validation<V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayElementConstraint, CapitalizeAllConstraint, CapitalizeConstraint, CascadeConstraint, CheckConstraint, CoalesceConstraint, CollectionElementConstraint, ConstraintAggregation, ConstraintComposition, ConstraintConjunction, ConstraintDisjunction, ConstraintGroupWrapper, ConstraintMessageWrapper, ConstraintNegation, ConstraintWrapper, CorrectConstraint, CustomConstraint, DefaultValueConstraint, DespaceConstraint, EmailAddressConstraint, EnumerationConstraint, EnumerationConstraint.Default, FileExistsConstraint, FileSizeConstraint, FutureDateConstraint, HostnameConstraint, IdentifierConstraint, IgnoreCaseEnumerationConstraint, IllegalCharsetConstraint, ImageSizeConstraint, ImageSizeConstraint.AwtCodec, ImageSizeConstraint.RawCodec, InetAddressConstraint, InstanceOfConstraint, Ip4AddressConstraint, Ip6AddressConstraint, IpAddressConstraint, IsFalseConstraint, IsNullConstraint, IsTrueConstraint, LegalCharsetConstraint, LogLevelConstraint, LowerCaseConstraint, MapKeyConstraint, MapValueConstraint, MaxLengthConstraint, MimeTypeConstraint, NotBlankConstraint, NotEmptyConstraint, NotEmptyConstraint.ArrayType, NotEmptyConstraint.CollectionType, NotEmptyConstraint.MapType, NotEmptyConstraint.StringType, NotNullConstraint, NullifyConstraint, PastDateConstraint, PropertyComparisonConstraint, PropertyComparisonConstraint.EqualToOp, PropertyComparisonConstraint.GreaterThanEqualOp, PropertyComparisonConstraint.GreaterThanOp, PropertyComparisonConstraint.LessThanEqualOp, PropertyComparisonConstraint.LessThanOp, PropertyComparisonConstraint.NotEqualToOp, RangeConstraint, RegexConstraint, RemoveNullElementsConstraint, RemoveNullElementsConstraint.ArrayType, RemoveNullElementsConstraint.CollectionType, ReplaceConstraint, SequenceElementConstraint, SetNullConstraint, SizeConstraint, SizeConstraint.ArrayType, SizeConstraint.CollectionType, SizeConstraint.MapType, SizeConstraint.StringType, SupportedEncodingConstraint, SupportedImageMimeConstraint, SupportedLocaleConstraint, SupportedTimeZoneConstraint, SysdateConstraint, TrimConstraint, UpperCaseConstraint, UriAddressConstraint, UrlAddressConstraint

    public interface Constraint<V>
extends Validation<V>
    The root interface in the constraint hierarchy. A constraint provides ability to validate values of certain data type. Constraint instances should be obtained from ConstraintFactory.
    Author:
    Fox Mulder
    See Also:
    ConstraintFactory

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Appends arguments to be substituted into the error message template.

      Returns localized error message template.
      Class<?> getType()
      Returns the type of value to be validated.
      <T> V validate(V value, ValidationContext<T> context)
      Validates the specified value using context if needed and returns possibly modified value.

      • getMessageTemplate

        String getMessageTemplate(ValidationContext<?> context)
        Returns localized error message template.

        This method may return null if constraint never generates ConstraintViolationException.

        Specified by:
        getMessageTemplate in interface Validation<V>
        Parameters:
        context - Validation context.
        Returns:
        Localized error message template.

      • appendMessageArguments

        boolean appendMessageArguments(ValidationContext<?> context,
                               Map<String,Object> arguments)
        Appends arguments to be substituted into the error message template.
        Specified by:
        appendMessageArguments in interface Validation<V>
        Parameters:
        context - Validation context.
        arguments - Arguments to be substituted into the error message template.
        Returns:
        true if error message template needs to be rendered; false otherwise.

      • validate

        <T> V validate(V value,
               ValidationContext<T> context)
        Validates the specified value using context if needed and returns possibly modified value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of validated entity.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to be validated.
        context - Validation context.
        Returns:
        Possibly modified value.
        Throws:
        ConstraintViolationException - if validation fails.
